meta.name: description
meta.content: The Pelham School District, in collaboration with the community we serve, is committed to providing a high-quality, contemporary education in a safe and inclusive environment. Our goal is to educate, prepare, and inspire all students to achieve their full potential as life-long learners, critical thinkers, and contributing citizens to our global society.

div.p: Inspiring success one mind at a time
New COVID-19 Website

In Pelham, the safety of our students and staff is our priority. Refer to the COVID-19 website for regular updates and resources in an effort to help families reduce the risk in their homes and community.

h3.a: Free and Reduced Meal Application Options

div.p: You may have already heard Governor Sununu just recently announced that New Hampshire schools will remain in remote learning status until the end of this school year. I know this is a challenge for staff, students, parents, and the community. All of us have…

h3.a: Pelham Fire & Police Parade on April 19

div.p: Join the Pelham Fire & Police Sunday April 19th for a socially distanced Truck & Car parade. Watch & wave as trucks and cars shine their lights through the town, right by your house. We will begin at 11:00am and arrive back at the station at approx. 2:00pm.…

Another week has gone by and we are starting to get into the groove! Thank you all for the feedback in the recent survey. By sharing what is going well and the challenges you are having, we have been able to remain flexible and adjust how we approach remote…

The Pelham School Board enthusiastically announces the selection of Dr. Eric “Chip” McGee as the next Superintendent of the Pelham School District. Dr. McGee will assume his leadership duties on July 1, 2020.
Dr. McGee brings with him a wealth of…

We are completing our third week of remote learning. We implemented remote learning with just one day of preparation. This is an amazing accomplishment and I believe we have exceeded all expectations given this short time frame. There have been many…

This week's School Board meeting will be recorded remotely at Sherburne Hall tonight, Wednesday, April 1st, starting at 6:30pm. It will air on PTV and on the Youtube Channel (https://www.youtube.com/user/PelhamNHTV). Due to the Stay at Home order, we will be…

A new week begins. I hope everyone had an opportunity to enjoy the weekend and disconnect for a little bit. Thank you all for your response to our recent survey to help us plan and improve remote learning opportunities for our students and staff. So far we…

As we continually try to improve remote learning, we need your feedback. We have created a short survey for you to help identify what is working and what we need to work on. We appreciate your feedback. This survey is for students, parents, and staff!
Please…

I hope all of you are doing well and have been able to stay healthy and productive! Just a couple of quick notes to keep you informed and up to date. On today’s conference call with the Commissioner of Education, Frank Edelblut, he indicated that hopefully by…

h3.a: Preschool, Kindergarten and 1st Grade Registration Information & Packets

div.p: Preschool, Kindergarten and 1st Grade Registration Information and Packets are now available. We will begin accepting completed registration packets in the front office at Pelham Elementary School on Monday, February 3rd at 10AM. PES is accepting registration packets daily between 10AM and 2PM.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Danielle Pilato at dpilato@pelhamsd.org or call 635-8875.
